Hi, Abin.

This suggests one necessary component (the JE disk-based datastore) has 
closed while the rest of the crawl tried to continue.

It might be a side-effect of earlier problem which is the real cause -- 
an IO or memory problem, for example. Are there any other earlier 
'Alerts' in the web console, or other exceptions in the heritrix_out.log?

- Gordon @ IA

mail2abin wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I am a new user Heritrix. Installed it, used some of its wonderful features in ( filters,scoping, frontier etc ). But it is giving me an exception as shown below after a while.
> 
> Need to know the reason and fix.
> I am running this on
> 
> Windows Machine XP , 256 MB RAM ,java version "1.6.0_12".
> Heritrix 1.14.3
> I hope someone would have answer.
> 
> ===============================================================
> Problem com.sleepycat.util.RuntimeExceptionWrapper: (JE 3.3.75) Can't open a cursor Database state can't be DbState.CLOSED must be DbState.OPEN occured when trying to process 'http://www.cs.stonybrook.edu/undergrad/honors/im3a.jpg' at step ABOUT_TO_BEGIN_PROCESSOR in HTTP
>  (in thread 'ToeThread #19: http://www.cs.stonybrook.edu/undergrad/honors/im3a.jpg'; in processor 'HTTP')
